title: AZ-104 Networking and Security Questions
description: Focused question bank for Azure Networking and Security topics

questions.question: You need to allow Azure services to access a storage account while blocking all other internet traffic. What should you configure?
questions.correct_answer: Storage account firewall with 'Allow trusted Microsoft services' exception
questions.explanation: Storage account firewall can be configured to block all public access except for trusted Microsoft services, providing secure access for Azure services.

questions.question: What is the maximum number of public IP addresses that can be associated with a single network interface?
questions.explanation: Each IP configuration on a network interface can have one public IP address. A single NIC can have multiple IP configurations.

questions.question: Which Azure service provides a centralized network security policy management across multiple subscriptions?
questions.explanation: Azure Firewall Manager provides central security policy and route management for cloud-based security perimeters across multiple subscriptions and virtual networks.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Azure Application Gateway?
questions.correct_answer: Provide Layer 7 load balancing and web application firewall
questions.explanation: Application Gateway is a Layer 7 load balancer that provides SSL termination, cookie-based session affinity, and optional web application firewall capabilities.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to filter network traffic between subnets in a virtual network?
questions.explanation: Network Security Groups contain security rules that filter network traffic between subnets and to/from resources within Azure virtual networks.

questions.question: What is the difference between service endpoints and private endpoints?
questions.correct_answer: Private endpoints provide a private IP, service endpoints extend VNet identity
wrong_answers: Service endpoints are more secure than private endpoints
Private endpoints only work with storage accounts
There is no difference between them
questions.explanation: Service endpoints extend VNet identity to Azure services over the Azure backbone, while private endpoints provide a private IP address for Azure services in your VNet.

questions.question: Which Azure service should you use to connect multiple virtual networks across different regions?
questions.explanation: Virtual network peering connects virtual networks seamlessly across regions through the Azure backbone network, enabling resources to communicate as if in the same network.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Azure Bastion?
questions.correct_answer: Provide secure RDP and SSH access without exposing public IPs
questions.explanation: Azure Bastion provides secure and seamless RDP and SSH connectivity to VMs directly through the Azure portal without exposing VMs to public IP addresses.

questions.question: Which protocol does Azure VPN Gateway use for site-to-site connections?
questions.explanation: Azure VPN Gateway uses IPsec/IKE protocols for site-to-site VPN connections, providing secure encrypted tunnels between on-premises and Azure networks.

questions.question: What is the maximum bandwidth for ExpressRoute Direct?
questions.explanation: ExpressRoute Direct provides dual 100 Gbps connectivity directly into Microsoft's global network at peering locations strategically distributed around the world.
